metadata.title: Evaluate to true if the win-def:port_test probe is properly supported
metadata.description: This definition is intended to evalutate to true if the interpreter properly supports the win-def:port_test probe.

notes.note: It is important to note that the values used in this test definition are specific to a particular machine, and may not necessarily apply to your system. As a result, in order to have the definition return a result of 'true', you must either change these values to the ones found on your particular system, or you must configure your system to use these values.
Information regarding the ports on your particular machine can be found by navigating to Start->Run... and by typing 'cmd'. Once a command prompt terminal is open simply type 'netstat -ano'.

criterion.comment: Test that a port_object with a local_address, local_port, and protocol is supported.
Test that a port_object with a local_address, local_port, and protocol with a pattern match used is supported.
Test that a port_object with a local_address pattern match, local_port, and protocol is supported.

port_test.comment: Test that a port_object with a local_address, local_port, and protocol is supported.
Test that a port_object with a local_address, local_port, and protocol with a pattern match used is supported.
Test that a port_object with a local_address pattern match, local_port, and protocol is supported.

port_object.comment: Retrieve the port object with the local_address equal to '0.0.0.0', the local_port equal to '135', and the protocol equal to 'TCP'.
Retrieve the port objects with the local_address not equal to '127.0.0.1', the local_port less than or equal to '65535', and the protocol that matches the regular expression '^U[D]P$'.

Retrieve the port objects with the local_address that matches the regular expression '([0-9])*\.([0-9])*\.([0-9])*\.([0-9])*', the local_port greater than or equal to '0', and the protocol not equal to 'UDP'.

port_state.comment: This state represents a port with a local address of '0.0.0.0', a local port '135' that when bitwise AND'd with the value '3' results in the value '3', a protocol equal to 'TCP', and a pid greater than or equal to '0'.

This state represents a port with a local address that matches the regular expression '([0-9])*\.([0-9])*\.([0-9])*\.([0-9])*', a local port that is greater than or equal to '0', a protocol that matches the regular expression '.*', and a pid greater than or equal to '0'.

This state represents a port with a local address that matches the regular expression '([0-9])*\.([0-9])*\.([0-9])*\.([0-9])*', a local port that is less than or equal to '0', a protocol not equal to 'UDP', and a pid greater than or equal to '0'.

constant_variable.comment: This variable utilizes the work-around to use the pattern match operation on an enumeration. This variable is referenced in the object 'oval:org.mitre.oval.test:obj:1074'. This regular expression matches the string 'UDP'.

This variable utilizes the work-around to use the pattern match operation on an enumeration. This variable is referenced in the state 'oval:org.mitre.oval.test:ste:871'. This regular expression matches any string.
